required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MyHealthCheckup Wellness Program Among Canadian Forces Military Personnel
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of the MyHealthCheckup Wellness Program Among Canadian Forces Military Personnel

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This research is collecting data to determine the benefits of a web-based wellness program designed to improve the health and well-being of individuals in the workplace. Participants will be invited to participate in a web-based Healthy Weight Program. The program is designed to optimize health and wellbeing by promoting physical activity and healthy eating.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Waist circumference measured at the umbilicus

arm_group.description: Subjects will have access to a web-based weight loss program for an 8-week period.

arm_group.arm_group_label: On-line health coaching in addition to web-based program
arm_group.description: Subjects will have access to the web-based wellness program and will also receive weekly personalized health coaching emails.

intervention.arm_group_label: On-line health coaching in addition to web-based program

intervention.description: A 4-week web-based wellness program with weekly personalized on-line health coaching.
intervention.arm_group_label: On-line health coaching in addition to web-based program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A military member of the Canadian Forces Base in Halifax
Exclusion Criteria:
-

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, McGill Comprehensive Health Improvement Program

clinical_study.keyword: body mass index greater that 25 kg/m2
